meanings.definition: An act of kindness or goodwill
meanings.sent1: She asked for a favour from her friend to help with homework.
meanings.sent2: It is always nice to do someone a favour when they need help.
meanings.sent3: The favour of sharing her lunch made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His favour towards strangers showed his generous nature.
meanings.sent5: The favour of holding the door open for others is a simple act of kindness.

meanings.sent1: I favour chocolate ice cream over vanilla.
meanings.sent2: Many people favour sunny days for outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: She tends to favour bright colors in her wardrobe.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will favour students who put effort into their work.
meanings.sent5: His parents favour traditional values when making decisions.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to favour local businesses for supplies.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often favour policies that benefit their constituents.
meanings.sent3: The coach will favour players who show dedication and teamwork.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will favour students who participate actively in class.
meanings.sent5: She will favour candidates with experience for the job.

meanings.sent1: His favour for spicy food made him stand out in the group.
meanings.sent2: The team sought the manager's favour for their new project.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed its favour for the cozy blanket by napping on it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's favour for neat handwriting was evident in her grading.
meanings.sent5: The judge's favour for fairness was respected by all in the courtroom.

meanings.definition: A small gift or token of appreciation
meanings.sent1: She received a favour of handmade earrings from her friend.
meanings.sent2: The party guests left with a small favour as a thank you for attending.
meanings.sent3: The wedding guests each took home a favour to remember the special day.
meanings.sent4: The students were delighted with the favour of stickers from the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The favour of a keychain was a thoughtful gesture from the host.
